title: Adding StdXObserver Docs
body: Adding some docs, related to #2266 and #2301.

title: Fix debug assert on map_state.num_covered_map_indexes
Allow trailing comma in feedback macros
body: This does not change any functionality, but makes the macros a bit easier to use, because they don't fail to match if there is a trailing comma for some reason.

title: Multimachine cleanup
body: I addressed some obvious clippy errors while reading the code.

title: Add support for cycling PowerSchedule on completion of a queue cycle in WeightedScheduler
body:
Based on:
https://github.com/AFLplusplus/AFLplusplus/blob/stable/src/afl-fuzz.c#L2764-L2798

There are a few schedules which need to be implemented

title: Fixing Frida ASAN tests on Windows
body: This PR fixes libafl_frida ASAN tests on Windows. There are a few things left to fix: the newly added Frida allocator test (on Windows) and adding these tests to the CI on Windows (it looks like they do not run; guidance on how to add them properly would be appreciated).

title: Make adaptive serialization into default
body:
why not?
i'm tired of seeing repeated code in event manager. these cfgs are totally not needed

also clean up the API a bit.
because now we should always pass the Handle<Something> to the interface

title: Rename string stages to unicode stages for consistency
Do not format Little CMS by default
abort() when the weakly defined LLVMFuzzerTestOneInput is linked
Cleanup for #2280
body:
- `SP` is not needed
- `LlmpBrokerState` is strange, you have method calls such as `self.state_mut().forward_msg(msg)?;`, but a state will send nothing. renamed it to`LlmpBrokerInner`

title: fix: `libafl_libfuzzer` build script
body:
- features check was inverted
- print helpful message when `llvm-nm` wasn't found, which happens to be the case on _stable_

title: fix WeightedScheduler reporting incorrect queue cylces
body: WeightedScheduler would never report a complete cycle since the runs would always be set to zero before it got the chance to surpass the corpus count. This PR fixes it

title: LLmp hooks
body:
replaces closures in llmp with a proper hook system, built using the tuple pattern.
we should use this pattern whenever we can imho, it s a good design

title: Closure builder for inner managers of centralized.
body: the closures are different for the main node and the secondary nodes for finer-grained configuration.

title: Revert "Revert "Add always_interesting option to llmp mgr""
body: Reverts AFLplusplus/LibAFL#2274

title: change Stability calculation formla to AFL++'s
Revert "Add always_interesting option to llmp mgr"
body:
Reverts AFLplusplus/LibAFL#2262

It's not working.

title: Enforce max_input_size and min_input_size in Forkserver
libafl_qemu_build: Disable docs in user mode
body: I observed a qemu build failure when writing unit tests for my fuzzer that was related to sphinx failing. I found disabling the docs fixed the failure. I think this is probably a good default, and it seems docs are already being disabled for system mode.

title: Fix docs on crates.io for LibAFL_Frida, introduce auto-download feature
body:
Let's see if this works :) 
cc @s1341

body: This updates ratatui

Breaking changes

title: Fix `libafl_qemu.h`
body:
fix #2249.
also added a testcase to avoid this kind of issue in the future

title: Introduce feedbacks hit tracking for testcases
body:
Work in progress.

I decided to use Name instead of Handle since Feedback is a trait and I'm not sure how that would work for Testcase since Handle expects a type. Maybe we can make a wrapper type? `TrackedFeedback`?

Once the general approach is decided, the implementation will be done for `Objective` as well

title: Implement tuple mapping
body:
This allows for the mapping of all tuple members to another type, potentially as a generic of the original type.

See the test for details.

title: Adding DiffExitKindFeedback
body: This simple `Feedback` just checking if any kind of `ExitKind::Diff` was returned. If you're doing differential fuzzing, you'll most likely use this.

title: LibAFL_Libfuzzer: Add clippy warnings
body: @addisoncrump copy&pasted these from the main lib. It doesn't change much and right now doesn't catch anything, either, but might be nice to have

title: Rename peek_next_free_id to peek_free_id (that it's the next is obvious)
body: @R9295 What do you think?

title: Make every Builder ::builder(), so  BobTheBuilder::new() becomes BobThe::builder()
body:
Unifies all builders.  Unionize!

Also adds a NopShMemProvider and fixes a bunch of new clippy lints.

title: Pre-commit hooks
body:
I thought it would be nice to share this, I've been using it for a few days and it's convenient.
It should also help lighten the CI's burden, avoiding useless runs.
Maybe we also would like to run other things in the future, for now I only put fmt since it's fast and does not cost much to have around.

title: Generic QEMU snapshot checking
body:
check qemu snapshot correctness generically, with better typing.
for now, it mostly concerns systemmode since usermode snapshot does not implement the `SnapshotManager` trait yet.

title: Introduce StageId (extends #2201)
body: This extends #2201 by @langston-barrett

title: Making StdOutObserver and StdErrObserver implement Observer
body:
Not sure why this wasn't done before, but it is necessary to work in combination with `DiffExecutor`s.

Oh, and I also added the calls to `pre_exec_child` and `post_exec_child` in `CommandExecutor`, since those are used to reset the `stdout`/`stderr` in the observers. Again not sure why this was missing.

title: Refactor events/llmp.rs
body:
separate these into multiple files.
use builder pattern
fix sampling_rate

title: Clean up samplig_rate, add docs
body: Follow-up to ##2226, cc @s1341

title: launcher: add launch_delay option
body: This adds a `launch_delay` option, which specifies a delay in milliseconds to wait between launches of fuzzers.

title: Add testcase sampling rate
body:
This PR adds the ability to 'sample' testcases. In other words it allows for a user-specified 'sampling rate', which is used to decide which TestCases to send to the broker.

A sampling rate of 10 means that only every tenth TestCase is sent to the broker.

This can be useful in very large scale fuzzing where the broker is overwhelmed by the volume of TestCases, and to cause the fuzz nodes to diverge somewhat more from each other.

title: Confuse clippy less
body: Clippy in main claims it doesn't want to infer this type, so maybe this helps.

title: Run Clippy on macOS
body: Because I have to fix all of the clippy lints all the time...

title: Remove unused dependencies
body: There are probably more, remove if you see them! :)

title: Add BytesSubInput that allows us to mutate sub-parts of a bytes-backed input
body:
This is a handy feature for a bunch of use-cases.
I don't think it will currently work for splicing mutators, simply because they assume the input used in the mutator has the same type as the input in the corpus.

This should help for #2202 and more.

title: Faster fmt_all.sh
body:
Makes `fmt_all.sh` 30 times faster on my local machine.
Requires `parallel` to work, but I think it's not a problematic dependency.

title: Report 100% stability if no unstable edges are found (extends #2215)
body: This extends #2215 to be restart-safe

title: Rename CurrentCorpusIdx -> CurrentCorpusId
body:
See discussion in #2201 -> https://github.com/AFLplusplus/LibAFL/pull/2201#issuecomment-2118940872

We currently use `CorpusId` but `current_corpus_idx`, technically confusing index and identifier...
Now that stages get a true index, we'll have to rename the corpus case

title: New forkserver
body: still wip

title: add AFL stage names for calibration, colorization, power and sync stages
body: Implements and closes #2179

title: LibAFL Dynamic Analysis
body:
follow up for #2178 
the plan is 
- [x] this pass logs all the hashed function signature.
- [x] and writes the hash into a global, this list should contain all the hashes of the functions that executions went through
- [x] an observer (built upon ListObserver) should observe the list 
- [x] then do the lookup to find the static analysis info

Updates the requirements on [hostname](https://github.com/svartalf/hostname) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from hostname's changelog.

[0.4.0] - 2024-04-01

Added

  • CI setup now covers almost all supported Tier 1 and Tier 2 platform targets

Changed

  • Minimum Supported Rust version set to 1.67.0
  • Rust edition set to "2021"

Fixed

  • Handle edge cases for POSIX systems (#14)
  • docs.rs documentation build

[0.3.1] - 2020-02-28

Fixed

  • Enabling hostname::set doctests only if "set" feature is enabled (#10)

[0.3.0] - 2019-12-19

Added

  • Cargo feature set which enables the hostname::set function compilation (disabled by default)
  • Note that hostname::set will fail the compilation for Android API < 23

Changed

  • hostname::set is available only with Cargo set feature enabled
  • Fix compilation issue for FreeBSD, DragonFlyBSD and iOS targets (#9)
  • Deprecated function get_hostname was removed, use get instead

[0.2.0] - 2019-11-09

Added

  • MSRV policy, Rust 1.19 version is set as minimally supported
  • get function which returns the current hostname (replaces get_hostname function)
  • set function which allows to change the hostname

Changed

  • Windows implementation returns the DNS host name of local computer instead of the NetBIOS name
  • Windows implementation works with the Unicode now instead of ANSI encoding

Fixed

title: Update pyo3-build-config requirement from 0.18 to 0.21

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [pyo3-build-config](https://github.com/pyo3/pyo3) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from pyo3-build-config's releases.

PyO3 0.21.2

This release contains some fixes to compile-time edge cases for the PyO3 0.21 series:

  • A missing deprecation warning for the GIL Ref constructor PySet::empty has now been added.
  • #[pymodule] functions will no longer trigger missing_docs lints on their generated code.
  • Incorrect implementations of __traverse__ in #[pymethods] will now emit a better error.
  • Extension modules on AIX will now link to libpython.

This release also fixes some compile errors for the experimental-async and experimental-declarative-modules features, and corrects some documentation typos.

Thank you to the following users for the improvements:

@​adamreichold @​blmarket @​davidhewitt @​Icxolu @​lfn3 @​messense @​wyfo

Changelog

Sourced from pyo3-build-config's changelog.

[0.21.2] - 2024-04-16

Changed

  • Deprecate the PySet::empty() gil-ref constructor. #4082

Fixed

  • Fix compile error for async fn in #[pymethods] with a &self receiver and more than one additional argument. #4035
  • Improve error message for wrong receiver type in __traverse__. #4045
  • Fix compile error when exporting a #[pyclass] living in a different Rust module using the experimental-declarative-modules feature. #4054
  • Fix missing_docs lint triggering on documented #[pymodule] functions. #4067
  • Fix undefined symbol errors for extension modules on AIX (by linking libpython). #4073

[0.21.1] - 2024-04-01

Added

  • Implement Send and Sync for PyBackedStr and PyBackedBytes. #4007
  • Implement Clone, Debug, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord and Hash implementation for PyBackedBytes and PyBackedStr, and Display for PyBackedStr. #4020
  • Add import_exception_bound! macro to import exception types without generating GIL Ref functionality for them. #4027

Changed

  • Emit deprecation warning for uses of GIL Refs as #[setter] function arguments. #3998
  • Add #[inline] hints on many Bound and Borrowed methods. #4024

Fixed

  • Handle #[pyo3(from_py_with = "")] in #[setter] methods #3995
  • Allow extraction of &Bound in #[setter] methods. #3998
  • Fix some uncovered code blocks emitted by #[pymodule], #[pyfunction] and #[pyclass] macros. #4009
  • Fix typo in the panic message when a class referenced in pyo3::import_exception! does not exist. #4012
  • Fix compile error when using an async #[pymethod] with a receiver and additional arguments. #4015

[0.21.0] - 2024-03-25

Added

  • Add support for GraalPy (24.0 and up). #3247
  • Add PyMemoryView type. #3514
  • Allow async fn in for #[pyfunction] and #[pymethods], with the experimental-async feature. #3540 #3588 #3599 #3931
  • Implement PyTypeInfo for PyEllipsis, PyNone and PyNotImplemented. #3577
  • Support #[pyclass] on enums that have non-unit variants. #3582
  • Support chrono feature with abi3 feature. #3664
  • FromPyObject, IntoPy<PyObject> and ToPyObject are implemented on std::duration::Duration #3670
  • Add PyString::to_cow. Add Py<PyString>::to_str, Py<PyString>::to_cow, and Py<PyString>::to_string_lossy, as ways to access Python string data safely beyond the GIL lifetime. #3677
  • Add Bound<T> and Borrowed<T> smart pointers as a new API for accessing Python objects. #3686
  • Add PyNativeType::as_borrowed to convert "GIL refs" to the new Bound smart pointer. #3692

... (truncated)

Commits
  • a646a82 release: 0.21.2
  • bd15f92 Deprecate the PySet::empty gil-ref constructor (#4082)
  • 4f7c706 Suppress non_local_definitions lint as we often want the non-local effects in...
  • 3f6faf0 Extend guide on interaction between method receivers and lifetime elision. (#...
  • 4e13c0e Link libpython for AIX target (#4073)
  • e501377 fix declarative-modules compile error (#4054)
  • fd18955 add #[doc(hidden)] to the Rust module created by #[pymodule] (#4067)
  • e174a04 Minor: Fix a typo in Contributing.md (#4066)
  • a8abe50 build(deps): bump peaceiris/actions-gh-pages from 3 to 4 (#4062)
  • 68d1973 Fix typo (#4052)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Update reqwest requirement from 0.11 to 0.12

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [reqwest](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from reqwest's releases.

v0.12.4

What's Changed

  • Add zstd support, enabled with zstd Cargo feature (thanks @​paolobarbolini!)
  • Add ClientBuilder::read_timeout(Duration), which applies the duration for each read operation. The timeout resets after a successful read.

New Contributors

  • @​SamuelMarks made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#2245
Changelog

Sourced from reqwest's changelog.

v0.12.4

  • Add zstd support, enabled with zstd Cargo feature.
  • Add ClientBuilder::read_timeout(Duration), which applies the duration for each read operation. The timeout resets after a successful read.

v0.12.3

  • Add FromStr for dns::Name.
  • Add ClientBuilder::built_in_webpki_certs(bool) to enable them separately.
  • Add ClientBuilder::built_in_native_certs(bool) to enable them separately.
  • Fix sending content-length: 0 for GET requests.
  • Fix response body content_length() to return value when timeout is configured.
  • Fix ClientBuilder::resolve() to use lowercase domain names.

v0.12.2

  • Fix missing ALPN when connecting to socks5 proxy with rustls.
  • Fix TLS version limits with rustls.
  • Fix not detected ALPN h2 from server with native-tls.

v0.12.1

  • Fix ClientBuilder::interface() when no TLS is enabled.
  • Fix TlsInfo::peer_certificate() being truncated with rustls.
  • Fix panic if http2 feature disabled but TLS negotiated h2 in ALPN.
  • Fix Display for Error to not include its source error.

v0.12.0

  • Upgrade to hyper, http, and http-body v1.
  • Add better support for converting to and from http::Request and http::Response.
  • Add http2 optional cargo feature, default on.
  • Add charset optional cargo feature, default on.
  • Add macos-system-configuration cargo feature, default on.
  • Change all optional dependencies to no longer be exposed as implicit features.
  • Add ClientBuilder::interface(str) to specify the local interface to bind to.
  • Experimental: disables the http3 feature temporarily.

v0.11.27

  • Add hickory-dns feature, deprecating trust-dns.
  • (wasm) Fix Form::text() to not set octet-stream for plain text fields.

v0.11.26

  • Revert system-configuration upgrade, which broke MSRV on macOS.

v0.11.25

  • Fix Certificate::from_pem_bundle() parsing.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • de5dbb1 v0.12.4
  • 0f126f5 tests: fix blocking test about empty bodies and content-length
  • 1073881 feat: add zstd support (#1866)
  • 1af8945 feat: add ClientBuilder::read_timeout(dur) (#2241)
  • e99da85 refactor: fix warnings related to mutability of self (#2245)
  • 0720159 v0.12.3
  • 9209695 Remove duplicate example for ClientBuilder::default_headers (#2236)
  • e3a1565 fix: use lower case domain string when using resolve and resolve_to_addrs...
  • b4c491a feat: allow fine-grained root certs for rustls (#2232)
  • cf4295d chore: update winreg to 0.52.0 (#2226)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Fixed infinite loop on SyncDiskStage
body:
Previously, the synchronization process in `SyncFromDiskStage` would get the fuzzer stuck in an infinite loop if one of the synced files caused the target to crash or timeout. This issue arose because `state.last_time` was updated only after all files were evaluated. If a file caused the target to crash, `state.last_time` wasn't updated, leading the fuzzer to continuously sync the same buggy testcases, resulting in an infinite loop.

Now, files are added to `self.to_sync` for syncing, and `state.last_time` is updated only after each file has been successfully evaluated. Additionally, files are removed from `self.to_sync` before evaluation to prevent duplicate processing, ensuring that each file is processed exactly once.

title: Use MultiMonitor when fuzzing in non-forking mode
body: I saw that coverage is not printed when not using `-fork=1`. This changes the output to include coverage.

body: added the possibility to add custom command definitions

title: Add client_stats to OnDiskJSONMonitor
body:
This adds all client_stats to the continuous JSON logging file. This is nice for visualization, e.g., here: https://github.com/eknoes/libafl-dashboard

If you think that its too much, saving all client stats, I could also make it configurable, however you guys prefer.

title: Fix hook_func and implement deinit
body:
This patch fixes hook_func and implements deinit. The issue with hook_func was that hooked implementations would run in non-harness code as well (Resulting in odd errors from stalked portions of frida). This has been fixed.

Startup should also be much faster on macos as it was earlier attempting to poison the MALLOC_NANO region which is unusually high in memory resulting in 1 min+ startup. 

Should pass all tests now on unix and macos.

title: Static analysis pass
body:
Now the paper is accepted so I can make this public.

This is the first step. we'll further need an observer to observe the edges that an execution went through, and do the lookup from these data

title: Regenerate QEMU binding stubs only for newer versions of the nightly compiler
body:
Stubs were getting regenerated randomly, causing many ppl to have them in their PRs.
Now, they will only be regenerated for new versions of nightly, that way it should be good enough.

title: Fix MacOS CI race condition
body: The `test_inprocessfork_exec` fn didn't use `serial`, so it will fail on MacOS where only one `StdShMemProvider` can exist at any time

title: Revert "Update zip requirement from 0.6 to 1.2"

    --- stdout

Sourced from which's changelog.

6.0.1

  • Remove dependency on once_cell for Windows users, replace with std::sync::OnceLock.

6.0.0

  • MSRV is now 1.70
  • Upgraded all dependencies to latest version

5.0.0

  • Remove several unused error messages
  • Windows executables can now be found even if they don't have a '.exe' extension.
  • Add new error message, Error::CannotGetCurrentDirAndPathListEmpty

4.4.2

  • Remove dependency on dirs crate due to MPL licensing in its tree. Use home crate instead. (@​Xaeroxe)

4.4.1

  • Add tilde expansion for home directory (@​Xaeroxe)
  • Swap out libc for rustix, forbid unsafe (@​notgull)
